channel.title: ::banuser ::ipbanuser
channel.description:
hi ive got ::banuser on my server but it doh work say when i type ::banuser mrgreen92
can u send me the ::banuser here and the ::ipbanuser thankyou

item.title: ::banuser ::ipbanuser
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“bumbumlongtime, post:11, topic:57348”]here

if (command.equals("banuser")) { try{ String otherPName = command.substring(6); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if(otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; appendToBanned(p.connectedFrom); sendMessage("You successfully ipbanned " + otherPName); } else { sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Try entering a name you want to ban"); } }

can only admins do this??

[br][size=1]Posted on: February 11, 2007, 08:34:35 PM[/size][hr]sorry im talking on on screen-keyboards keyboard broke sorry[br][size=1]Posted on: February 11, 2007, 08:36:59 PM[/size][hr]is that ok? liansford?? i change the thing from ::ipban name to ::banuser name will that work thanks and can only admins ban… using that be cause it havent got a 2…-3/////[/quote]
That would ban a player’s IP address.

Read full topic

item.title: ::banuser ::ipbanuser

@liamsford wrote:

Source? If pvpscape… When you do “::ipban (username)” it just bannes them regular, not I.P. ban. Also ::banuser dosn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: ::banuser ::ipbanuser
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Well, let’s see. For banning usernames:

if(command.startsWith("banuser")) { String name = command.substring(8); if(appendToBanned(name)) { sendMessage(name + " has been banned"); } }

And add this boolean:

public boolean appendToBanned(String name) try { File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt"); BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file)); BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file, true)); for(int i = 0; i < file.length(); i++) String line = null; while((line = br.readLine()) != null) { if(line.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) { return false; break; } } } bw.write(name); bw.newLine(); bw.flush(); bw.close(); return true; } catch(IOException e) { sendMessage("Error writing or reading the bans file"); } return false; }

Work with that code.

Read full topic

item.title: ::banuser ::ipbanuser
item.dc:creator: @jehanne jehanne
item.description:
@jehanne wrote:

what source is your server based on? here is my banuser cmd…

[code] if(command.startsWith(“banuser”) && (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin”)))
{
String victim = command.substring(8);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" is banning "+victim);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully banned”);
appendToBanned(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/banlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" banned"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
 }
  }

  try {
     bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("C:/Documents and Settings/Jehanne/My Documents/my server stuff/adminpk/banlogs.txt", true));
 bw.write(playerName+" banned"+victim);
 bw.newLine();
 bw.flush();
  } catch (IOException ioe) {
 ioe.printStackTrace();
  } finally {
 if (bw != null) try {
    bw.close();
 } catch (IOException ioe2) {
    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
 }
  }

}[/code]

remember to change the C:/Documents and Settings/Jehanne/My Documents/my server stuff/adminpk/banlogs.txt in my cmd to the place of your files…[br][size=1]Posted on: February 11, 2007, 10:05:46 AM[/size][hr]i mean, the place of your banlogs

Read full topic
